security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill consisting only of documentation. No executable code, no scripts, no network access, no file system access beyond local configuration. The skill provides instructions to modify a local JSON state file and confirm changes to the user.

content.value_statement: Claude Router captures insights automatically during your work. This skill lets you disable that continuous learning mode when you prefer manual control over what gets recorded.
actual_capabilities: Read current learning mode state from knowledge/state.json
Update state to disable learning mode
Write modified state back to knowledge/state.json
Display session summary with extraction statistics
limitations: Only disables automatic extraction, not manual /learn commands
Does not delete existing captured insights
Cannot re-enable learning mode (use /learn-on skill instead)

use_cases.title: Stop automatic data collection
use_cases.description: Disable continuous learning when working with sensitive information

use_cases.title: Control insight gathering
use_cases.description: Pause automated insights during specific project phases

use_cases.title: Manual knowledge management
use_cases.description: Switch to manual extraction workflow for precise control

prompt_templates.title: Basic disable
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the learn-off skill to disable continuous learning mode

prompt_templates.title: Confirm status
prompt_templates.prompt: Turn off learning mode and show me the session summary

prompt_templates.title: Privacy focus
prompt_templates.prompt: Disable learning mode before I start working with confidential code

prompt_templates.title: Workflow switch
prompt_templates.prompt: Switch to manual learning mode and give me a summary of what was captured

output_examples.input: Use the learn-off skill to disable continuous learning mode
output: Session summary: Extractions performed: 12, Queries analyzed: 45, Insights captured: 8
Manual extraction is still available via /learn. Use /knowledge to view accumulated insights.

best_practices: Use before working with sensitive or proprietary code
Review extracted insights periodically with /knowledge command
Re-enable with /learn-on when you want automatic capture again
anti_patterns: Disabling learning mode assumes you will remember to use /learn manually
Do not expect captured insights to be deleted when disabling
Avoid leaving learning disabled permanently if you want automatic knowledge capture

faq.question: Is my data deleted when I disable learning mode?
faq.answer: No. Existing insights remain stored. Only automatic extraction stops.

faq.question: Can I still capture insights manually?
faq.answer: Yes. Use the /learn command for manual extraction anytime.

faq.question: What happens to my query history?
faq.answer: Query counting stops, but past statistics remain visible when you re-enable.

faq.question: Is this skill safe to use in professional environments?
faq.answer: Yes. It only modifies local state and does not transmit data externally.

faq.question: How do I re-enable learning mode?
faq.answer: Use the /learn-on skill to reactivate automatic insight extraction.

faq.question: Does this affect Claude Code differently than Claude?
faq.answer: No. Both tools use the same knowledge state file and learning mechanism.
